desc: The project includes five 5-minute videos about the Contra Costa College Math Jam Program aimed at recruiting faculty and students to join future Math Jam programs.The video will show the program both from the perspective of participating faculty and students. It will feature faculty members’ positive experiences and their contributions to the program. The video will emphasize the opportunities the program offers to participating faculty. Among them, building relationships with students, offering professional development opportunities, working as a part of a team, trying out new and creative ways of teaching, working with students in a holistic manner.The video will also show the program from the perspective of participating students and will show their experience as they learn and progress in the program. It will capture their positive impressions and the sense of achievement at the completion of the program. The video will emphasize many benefits of the program, among them: opportunity to build relationships with faculty, managing anxiety associated with learning math, enjoying a fun learning environment, fostering growth mindset, participating in the book loan program, providing access to resources.

desc: We need a series of website animations describing the methods used to install our star ceiling kits and star ceiling panels.The first will probably be the simplest, installing a star ceiling kit into a bedroom ceiling with an open attic or roof space above.Our kits consist of a light source or projector and a loom of fibre optic cables. We call this the 'harness'. The kits can be viewed on our website at [url removed, login to view]I would think the best way to approach this is to show a skeleton bungalow with the bedroom and the loft space visible.The first job is to tidy the work space and remove loft insulationThe light source is usually housed in the loft space with the source as close as possible to the centre of the fibre optic display. So, the animation should show electric cable snaking into the loft from the room below, a socked attached to the cable and a switch to the end in the room below.The next step is to drill (in the case of our Orion kit) 120 holes in the celling, this could be animated showing that drilling from below or above is acceptable.When the drilling is finished then the fibres from the harness can be inserted into the holes. The fibre harness is inserted into the light source and the fibres run neatly to the holes. The loft will have ceiling joists so the fibres could be shown snaking over, under or through the joists. If necessary holes can be shown to be cut through the joists.Next a dab of Silicone adhesive is put onto the top of the hole to secure the fibre. When this has dried the loft insulation can be re-laid.Next the fibres are trimmed to about 10mm and the ceiling is painted. When the paint is dry the fibres are cut flush. If you want to repaint the ceiling in the future leave the fibres 3mm long. They can be cut again when the ceiling is re-painted.The last frames will be a twinkly ceiling.I have found an animation style that I  like, the URL will be attached.ThanksJohn
title: Website animations

desc: Summarize. Summarizing the project means explaining the aims, outcomes, significance and benefits. You must use 3-5 sentences (or less) for writing the summary. The title of your project is to be placed at the beginning of the paper. Avoid using unnecessary and parenthetic words and expressions.Define. Defining the project means explaining what purpose to reach and what need to address. Under the purpose you write about the main intent for project startup. Under the need you must define the business problem to be solved or the opportunity to be exploited,Justify. Justifying the project means proving that the project underpins some business goals and is significant to success of the performing organization. You must identify business drivers that lead change to the project and determine how the project impacts the performance of the organization.Evaluate. Evaluating means identifying the benefits to be gained upon successful completion of the project. You need to use the results of cost-benefit analysis to explain the ratio between the benefits to be gained and the cost to be covered.Approach. Approaching the project means selecting, approving and describing a method that is efficient for implementing the goals and objectives of the project within the current operational environment. You must have an approach along with a methodology that explains how to phase the project and what lifecycle to be followed.Schedule. Scheduling means performing a preliminary estimation of time needed for the project. You’ll need to develop a timeline that shows the total estimated amount of working hours required. Note that the timeline will be used later during the planning phase to develop the project schedule and estimate activity durations.Wrap. Wrapping the project is a slangy word I use here to explain the need for stating the requirements for your project. Wrapping means identifying all those limits, demands, needs, and other parameters that define the user expectations and interests as to the product and the implementation process. The requirements wrap the project making it limited and bounded in terms of the user expectations.Compensate. Compensating the project means identifying the results to be gained as a compensation of all those resources and effort invested in the implementation process. You need to create a description of the desired outcomes that are anticipated upon successful completion of the project. This data will be used later in developing the deliverables list.
title: Make a Video

desc: For freelancers near Tacoma, Washingron, USA.Hello, my name is Coleman. I am the project manager of an upcoming project titled The Monarch Butterfly Fund Flight Challenge (MBFFC). What's the Monarch Butterdly Fund? We are an organization of scientists, thinkers, and individuals who all have a collective love for monarch butterflies. The Monarch Butterfly Fund's mission is to preserve the survival of the Monarch Butterfly. We do this by focusing on local economies in Central Mexico, better management of the Monarch food grounds and nesting areas, building public interest and involvement, and developing and aggregating scientific data on the species. It is the last two of these that the MBFFC is striving to employ with this challenge.The Monarch Butterfly Fund is looking to launch a major Kickstarter and we are seeking a local film-maker who can shoot and edit a short, 2 minute campaign video. This video should include: a hook and captivating intro, a brief outline of what the project is, what the money will be used for, and additional ways people can help. It should look professional and be coherent.If you are interested or may know someone who might be, or if you think you could help us in any other way, I would love to chat![Removed by [url removed, login to view] Admin]-Coleman
title: Tacoma, Washington. Monarch Butterfly Fund Kickstarter Video

desc: make me a 20 min. video about traffic in your city? Resolution: HD – Full HD (from 1280×720 to 1920×1080) • Low exposure time - 1000us or less (high shutter speed) for sharp image and to avoid motion blur • ONLY ONE LANE VISIBLE with 10-20% overlapping • If no vehicle on image only the road must be visible • Camera must look downward (no sky, no background objects like fence, trees, buildings, pedestrians, etc.)
title: Make a Video in USA
